title: 107_hr542
content: The Act titled "Small Business Review Panel Technical Amendments Act of 1999" is cited in Section 1. Section 2 outlines the findings and purposes of the Act. The Congress finds that a vibrant small business sector is crucial for job creation in the economy, with small businesses facing a disproportionate share of regulatory burdens. Federal agencies need to consider the impact of regulations on small businesses early in the rulemaking process. The Small Business Advocacy Review Panel process, established by the Small Business Regulatory Enforcement Fairness Act of 1996, allows small businesses to participate in developing rules effectively. The Small Business Regulatory Enforcement Fairness Act aims to involve small businesses in federal regulatory processes by providing a forum for participation and strengthening the Small Business Advocacy Review Panel process. It also seeks to expand the number of federal agencies required to convene these panels. SEC. 3. Ensuring full analysis of potential impacts on small entities of rules proposed by certain agencies. Section 609(b) of title 5, United States Code is amended to require covered agencies to notify the Chief Counsel for Advocacy of the Small Business Administration before publishing an initial regulatory flexibility analysis. This notification must include information on the potential impacts of the proposed rule on small entities. The covered agencies must notify the Chief Counsel for Advocacy of the Small Business Administration before publishing an initial regulatory flexibility analysis. This includes identifying affected small entity representatives and obtaining advice on the potential impacts of the draft proposed rule. When a covered agency transmits information for a draft proposed rule, a review panel of federal employees will be convened. The panel will include employees from the agency responsible for the rule, the Office of Information and Regulatory Affairs, and the Chief Counsel. The panel will review all materials related to the proposed rule and gather advice and recommendations. The review panel of federal employees will gather advice and recommendations from small entity representatives on issues related to specific sections of the rule. Small entity representatives may also make oral presentations to the panel. Within 60 days, the panel must report to the head of the agency on the comments received from the small entity representatives. The review panel of federal employees gathers advice and recommendations from small entity representatives on specific rule sections. The head of the agency must publish the panel's report in the Federal Register within 120 days. The agency may modify the proposed rule based on the report. The agency must publish the panel's report in the Federal Register within 120 days for the proposed rule. SEC. 4. DEFINITIONS. Amends Section 609(d) of title 5, United States Code to define 'covered agency' as EPA, OSHA, and IRS, and 'small entity representative' as a small entity or its representative. SEC. 5. EFFECTIVE DATE. The Act will take effect 90 days after enactment.
